Class AsciiGrid

  • java.lang.Object
    • AsciiGrid

  • public class AsciiGrid
extends java.lang.Object
    define a 2D array of chars as a way to make ascii art. can place and clear an arbitrary 2D array of chars in the grid if asked-for array fits.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AsciiGrid()
      Constructor
      AsciiGrid(int row, int col)
      Constructor

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean clearShape(char[][] shape, int r, int c)
      clear the elements in the grid defined by the 2D shape starting at grid at location (r,c).
      char[][] getChars()
      return a row x col array of the current char array This should be a full/deep copy, not a reference to internal storage
      int[] getSize()
      Return the width and height of the grid
      boolean placeShape(char[][] shape, int r, int c)
      place the 2D shape in the grid at location (r,c) only if every row of the shape fits in the grid and doesn't intersect any non-empty spaces.
      java.lang.String toString()
      create a nice, printable representation of the grid and filled coordinates the grid should be framed.

        public AsciiGrid(int row,
         int col)
        Constructor
        Parameters:
        row - number of rows in the ascii grid
        col - number of columns in the ascii grid

    • Method Detail

      • getChars

        public char[][] getChars()
        return a row x col array of the current char array This should be a full/deep copy, not a reference to internal storage
        Returns:
        array of chars

      • placeShape

        public boolean placeShape(char[][] shape,
                 int r,
                 int c)
        place the 2D shape in the grid at location (r,c) only if every row of the shape fits in the grid and doesn't intersect any non-empty spaces. Otherwise don't place the shape
        Parameters:
        shape - 2D array of chars to put on the Grid
        r - row in the grid where to place the first row of the shape
        c - column in the grid where to place the first column of the shape
        Returns:
        true, if successful false otherwise

      • clearShape

        public boolean clearShape(char[][] shape,
                 int r,
                 int c)
        clear the elements in the grid defined by the 2D shape starting at grid at location (r,c). The contents of the shape are irrelevant only the dimensions of each row are used. Clear only if every row of the shape fits in the grid. Cleared elements in the grid are set to the EMPTY char.
        Parameters:
        shape - 2D array of chars. Defines the shape to
        r - row in the grid where to start the clearing
        c - column in the grid where to start the clearing
        Returns:
        true, if successful false otherwise

      • getSize

        public int[] getSize()
        Return the width and height of the grid
        Returns:
        array where index=0 is nrows, index=1 nrows

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        create a nice, printable representation of the grid and filled coordinates the grid should be framed. A row of "=' (length = width of grid + 2) should be used to frame the top and bottom of the grid. The '|' should be used to frame the left and right side of each row of the grid. e.g 1x1 empty grid 2 x 2 empty grid === ==== | | | | === | | ====
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
